instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD – once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
No visible corrosion, boots to OS with fan full speed then shuts down after about 30secs-1min. Also shuts down with everything disconnected. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.24v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL>: 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>: 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>: 1.5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>: 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message: It also shuts down on smc bypass and safe mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Did you try known good trackpad board/cable?
It can be a reason for full speed fan.
Does the fan spins to max from moment zero, or increases speed in 15-20s?

The above mentioned voltages took with machine turned on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
It stills shuts down without trackpad connected. 

It takes about 2.5 secs to spin the fan, and it goes to max from momento zero. 

Voltages taken with machine turned off after it shuts down. Not enough time to take voltages with it turned on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
You can take some voltages readings in 30s, for sure.
At least checking the big coils.
Restart it, if need more time to check another points.

Do you get correct <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Voltages with board turned on:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.24v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 5.06v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL>: 5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>:  3.3v (not steady, it drops a lot)

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>: 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>: 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>: 3.3v 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>: 3.3v  

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>: 1.8v

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> : 1.5v

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>: 1.5v

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>: 0.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
0.8V on CPU looks good; if drops from 1.15V initial.
However, you have a problem with SMC, or some of its signals; because <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> isn't controlled.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Remove internal HDD and test if stays on with USB macOS.
You can also test in boot menu.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Its showing very unstable behaviors. At first it didn't shut down with macos usb (i even installed catalina from usb and it didnt shut down), but now it shuts down with catalina and capitan install usb´s.

At some point i thought the wifi was causing the shutdowns since every time i tried to connect to wifi it shut down, so i disconnected the wifi cable and it started to show green light and regular fan spin (maybe just a casualty). But now its back to fast fan/dim green light.

Diode mode to ground:

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL>: 0.455

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> 0.455

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Did you test it disconnecting internal HDD?
Did it boot to USB macOS with normal fan speed?

Try known good trackpad cable/board.
Test again disconnecting webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Yeah, i disconnected internal HDD
No, still full fan speed. 

Tried it, no difference.
No difference with webcam disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message: Run corresponding EFI ASD, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message: Now the machine wont turn on, i have every rail except  <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> which is 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message:
Possibly bad PCH, or CPU.
Did you try known good BIOS for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light, turns on for 30 secs then shuts down
threads.message: Yes, just tried another one just in case.
